p: Small Tree Finches ( n = 246) most frequently used the techniques ‘probe’ (50%) and ‘feed’ (36%) and to a much lower percentage ‘glean’ (10%) and ‘bite’ (4%). Warbler Finches ( n = 363) were observed mainly using the techniques ‘probe’ (50%) and ‘glean’ (43%). Other techniques used were ‘sally’ (4%), ‘feed’ (2%) and ‘bite’ (1%).
